title: How to train custom data after creating mdb files.
body:
I finally create `data.mdb` and `lock.mdb` with this command:

`!python '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/create_lmdb_dataset.py' --inputPath '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train' --gtFile '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/gt.txt' --outputPath '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/result'`

Now I have to use another command to start training:

`!python '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py' --train_data '/content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train' --valid_data '/content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/val' --Transformation TPS --FeatureExtraction ResNet --SequenceModeling BiLSTM --Prediction Attn --select_data '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/result'`

But if I use this command the output will be:

```
Filtering the images containing characters which are not in opt.character
Filtering the images whose label is longer than opt.batch_max_length
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
dataset_root: /content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train
opt.select_data: ['/content/drive/My Drive/deep', 'text', 'recognition', 'benchmark', '1/result']
opt.batch_ratio: ['1']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py", line 315, in <module>
    train(opt)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py", line 31, in train
    train_dataset = Batch_Balanced_Dataset(opt)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/dataset.py", line 31, in __init__
    assert len(opt.select_data) == len(opt.batch_ratio)
AssertionError
```

And if I use this command without --select_data like this:

`!python '/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py' --train_data '/content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train' --valid_data '/content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/val' --Transformation TPS --FeatureExtraction ResNet --SequenceModeling BiLSTM --Prediction Attn`

The output will be:

```
Filtering the images containing characters which are not in opt.character
Filtering the images whose label is longer than opt.batch_max_length
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
dataset_root: /content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train
opt.select_data: ['/']
opt.batch_ratio: ['1']
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
dataset_root:    /content/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train	 dataset: /
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py", line 315, in <module>
    train(opt)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/train.py", line 31, in train
    train_dataset = Batch_Balanced_Dataset(opt)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/dataset.py", line 42, in __init__
    _dataset, _dataset_log = hierarchical_dataset(root=opt.train_data, opt=opt, select_data=[selected_d])
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/deep-text-recognition-benchmark-1/dataset.py", line 124, in hierarchical_dataset
    concatenated_dataset = ConcatDataset(dataset_list)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataset.py", line 188, in __init__
    assert len(datasets) > 0, 'datasets should not be an empty iterable'
AssertionError: datasets should not be an empty iterable
```

There is a train folder with 6 images.
There is a val folder but it's empty, is it ok? also have made things from this [link](https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/issues/85) What I'm doing wrong??
